column1: Narrator : NOMBATEAU bumps directly bumps into a wet and grassy soil. Behind a bunch of fields stands a farm.
Narrator : As CAPITAINE approaches, the farms turns out to be burnt, and abondonned. The air still smells of smole. A path stumbled with footsteps leads to the beach.
column8: Narrator : It’s a small and charming farm, surrounded bu fields. A young woman is removing weed. A path leads back to the beach, another go further in the hills.

column4: PlayerSpeak : Well well ! Those papers mention NOMTRESOR
column5: PlayerSpeak : Anything that’s left to read is only bills and receipes

column13: Narrator : CAPITAINE sees a hen house, near the farm. A few chickens run around

column8: Narrator : CAPITAINE approaches the hen house

column1: Narrator : The beach is empty. Only the sails of a pirate ship can be seen on the horizon.
Narrator : Looks like they are heading DIRECTIONTOFORMULA
column8: Choice : Let’s return to the farmer girl (partir)
column13: PlayerSpeak : Looks like the hens hid when I approached

column10: PlayerSpeak : It slipped for my hands
column11: PlayerSpeak : Oh no wait, I just caught feathers
column13: PlayerSpeak : Doesn’t matter, the farmer girl didn’t see me

column3: PlayerSpeak : The beach is straight up empty

column2: PlayerSpeak : Just a cute little crab

column9: PlayerSpeak : Looks like the farmer girl didn’t see us

column1: Narrator : A group of pirates ! They’re about to climb into their small boat
OtherSpeak : You’ll never get the treasure before us !

column2: PlayerSpeak : what a well furnished pantry !

column1: Narrator : With the farm girl gone, the door of the house is wide opened. A path leads further into the hills, another leads back to the boat.

column6: OtherSpeak : If you’ve got the room on board

column1: Narrator : The house is completly empty.
